column3: str
I take it you're keen to take advantage of my special offer? So, which book from the Trials of the Braves would you like purchase?
What are you interested in?
Nothing.
The Books of Fire (Raises <Sheet(BaseParam,IntegerParameter(1),1)/>). Completed: <Value>IntegerParameter(2)</Value> of <Value>IntegerParameter(3)</Value>
The Books of Fall (Raises <Sheet(BaseParam,IntegerParameter(1),1)/>). Completed: <Value>IntegerParameter(2)</Value> of <Value>IntegerParameter(3)</Value>
The Books of Wind (Raises <Sheet(BaseParam,IntegerParameter(1),1)/>). Completed: <Value>IntegerParameter(2)</Value> of <Value>IntegerParameter(3)</Value>
The Books of Earth (Raises <Sheet(BaseParam,IntegerParameter(1),1)/>). Completed: <Value>IntegerParameter(2)</Value> of <Value>IntegerParameter(3)</Value>
Books pertaining to swords.
Books pertaining to shields.
The Books of Fire (Raises <Sheet(BaseParam,IntegerParameter(1),1)/>). Completed: <Value>IntegerParameter(2)</Value> of <Value>IntegerParameter(3)</Value>
The Books of Fall (Raises <Sheet(BaseParam,IntegerParameter(1),1)/>). Completed: <Value>IntegerParameter(2)</Value> of <Value>IntegerParameter(3)</Value>
The Books of Wind (Raises <Sheet(BaseParam,IntegerParameter(1),1)/>). Completed: <Value>IntegerParameter(2)</Value> of <Value>IntegerParameter(3)</Value>
The Books of Earth (Raises <Sheet(BaseParam,IntegerParameter(1),1)/>). Completed: <Value>IntegerParameter(2)</Value> of <Value>IntegerParameter(3)</Value>
The Book of Netherfire (Raises <Sheet(BaseParam,IntegerParameter(1),1)/>). Completed: <Value>IntegerParameter(2)</Value> of <Value>IntegerParameter(3)</Value>
The Book of Netherfall (Raises <Sheet(BaseParam,IntegerParameter(1),1)/>). Completed: <Value>IntegerParameter(2)</Value> of <Value>IntegerParameter(3)</Value>

Now, I mentioned earlier that nine books comprise a set, but there are <Emphasis>different</Emphasis> sets as well. I had a quick browse through them, and it appears that each focuses on a particular weapon. If you have any preferences, please let me know.
Actions speak louder than words. Arm yourself with the relic weapon atma you wish to enhance, and speak with G'jusana once more.
...Hm? It appears we're completely out of books pertaining to that weapon. And small wonder, seeing as you're the one who cleaned us out!
You have already completed all the trials for the equipped relic weapon atma. Make your way to Hyrstmill, and present it to Jalzahn.
It appears you've already read all the books under that category. Might I interest you in something else?

Wait... Didn't I <Emphasis>just</Emphasis> sell you a book? As much as I'd like to offer you another, a part of me feels as though I'd be doing you a disservice. Think of it this way: the more you have, the less you appreciate!
You must complete all of the objectives in a book before you may purchase another. Alternately, you may also dispose of it by speaking with G'jusana, or via the Key Items menu.
Here it is, the book of your heart's desire. I have no doubt that it'll provide endless hours of entertainment! Have there ever been 100 <SheetEn(Item,3,　28,2,1)/> better spent? I think not!
You have obtained a book from the Trials of the Braves. The objectives therein can be verified by using the item in the Key Items menu.
Exchange <Format(IntegerParameter(3),FF022C)/> <SheetEn(Item,3,IntegerParameter(2),2,1)/> for <SheetEn(EventItem,1,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)/>?

The weapon you possess does not match your trial progress. Would you like to discard your <SheetEn(EventItem,3,IntegerParameter(1),1,1)/>, and purchase <SheetEn(EventItem,1,IntegerParameter(2),1,1)/> for <Format(IntegerParameter(4),FF022C)/> <SheetEn(Item,3,IntegerParameter(3),2,1)/>?
Yes
No

Oh dear, it seems you're short on <SheetEn(Item,3,　28,2,1)/>. I'm afraid I can't go any lower than 100 for such precious texts. Think of it this way: the harder you work for something, the more you appreciate it!
